data.why:
A suite of interface generalization modules and helper utilities
    for application development and deployment. These consist of a
    strictly defined core object set and the ability to create and nest
    objects arbitrarily and easily. The core utilizes a custom tied hash
    class with built in support for object recursion (aka widget
    nesting) and validation for hash values. Then a set of modules which
    use these special hashes and add interfaces for rendering(Gtk, HTML,
    text, XML, etc) and persistence(via DBI -> Oracle, Pg, mysql, etc;
    XML) to complete the picture.
